objects.ground: A valuable ring has been lost here! Pick it up quick!

extras.text: A large purple gem is set on a polished silver band.  There appears to be a small storm raging inside of the gem, and you become slightly transfixed by it. A feeling of protectiveness washes over you, and you feel that losing this ring would be the end of your life.

objects.ground: A piece of parchment titled with the initials WoF lies here abandoned.

extras.text: This deed entitles the clan known as the Weavers of Fate to the following items as paid for in their initial construction costs so long as they continue to pay maintainance costs of 10% of the total construction costs by the 5th of each month. At the time dues are collected the seal on this lease shall be updated to reflect the date the next collection shall take place. Note- Lease agreements may be inspected at any time to verify that all dues are up-to-date. Clan Construction details follow and a Holy Seal is placed at the bottom.

The following are details surrounding the costs and maintenance of the clan's hall and item: Inital Construction cost (2 rooms)   - 15K Additional rooms (3)                 -  9K Bulletin Boards (3)                  -  6k Guild Fountain                       -  2k One basic clan item (1500)           -  3K -------------------------------------------- Total                                - 35K Upkeep is 10% of total cost          - 3.5K

objects.ground: A clan announcements board hovers just above the fountain.
A huge leather-bound book lies open on the large loom.
A clipboard with the meeting agenda floats around the room.
A large stone fountain stands proudly in the middle of the room.

extras.text: Five uniquely chiseled statues stand in a perfect circle in the middle of the fountain.  The five beings stand back to back touching at the shoulders.  A figure of a charismatic druidess, an image of a terrifying dark warrior, the visage of a cunning ranger, an engraving of a stern priestess, and a carving of a twisted sorceress make up the body of the fountain.  Water flows from spouts below each statues feet into the trough encircling the circle of figures.

The image of Cerworn is one of a compassionate but serious woman, her eyes fixed steadily on an image you cannot see.  Her face is fixed in a gentle but firm motherly expression, a reflection of her beliefs in loving control.  The priestess is shown to be wearing a simple white dress, her hands folded in prayer.

Tall, but slim, Janara is a beautiful half-elf with long flowing auburn hair that reaches down to her waist.  Green foliage is wrapped around her exposing bits of tanned flesh, but covering up the essentials.  A large anaconda is wrapped around her body, with its head held by her hand, mouth wide open.

A creature of pure and unadulterated evil, Nuggz stands in an intimidating stance, ready to bash anything that comes his way.  He wears a permanent scowl on his face, the product of years of living a corrupted life style.

Wehr is leaning on a longbow, his hair long and wild looking.  A gentle expression on his face makes you relax, and feel all warm inside.  His eyes seem to be fixed directly upon you, and you feel as if your soul is being looked at.  A small wolf is standing next to him, looking up into his face as if asking for direction.
Glimmering silver hair falls down to the shoulders of this otherwise beautiful sorceress.  Cold piercing blue eyes indicate that Krytonius is not as nice as she looks.

objects.ground: A copper-tinged egg is sitting here.

extras.text: The shell is leathery and tough, but it lacks the warm pulse of life one expects from a living egg.  Though its species can only be guessed at, it is probably something that will grow up to be large in size.  The egg itself looks to be made of copper metal, though its leathery skin feels nothing like metal. It looks quite heavy, though, since it is about as large as the average gnome.

objects.ground: A portals floats in midair, crackling madly!

extras.text: You can barely make out A Diseased Battlefield.

rooms.name: A Secluded Cove
rooms.description: Small waves lap gently at the sandy beach of this secluded inlet.  A slight breeze from the open sea brings the scent of salt to your nose.  A small pier extends itself out into the clear waters to allow a small boat to be tied up. The cove is protected by tall cliffs that encircle the entire island.  Passage to the sea is possible through a small break in the cliffs directly to the west of you.

North.description: A large stone structure juts out from the cliffs.  It appears as though the back end of it is actually part of the cliff itself, and you surmise that the building is bigger than it appears from the outside.  The cliffs dominate the sky behind the building.

East.description: A small jungle spans out to the east, and it looks quite uninviting. Beyond the jungle, you can see the ever present cliffs soaring high over the jungle providing it protection from the outside world.

South.description: The cliff tapers to a fine point about two hundred feet above, and encircles the entire island, providing protection from the outside world.  The tall cliffs also prevent you from being able to see the waters that surrounds the small island.

West.description: A small strait has been cut directly through the cliff, allowing passage to the blue fog sea.  The strait seems to be a natural occurrence, but you cannot be sure.

extras.text: Crafted out of the finest gopher wood, this pier is made to last.  It boldly juts out into the cove, and looks like it would be fun to jump off of.

rooms.name: The Stone Fountain
rooms.description: You stand in a huge chamber built from huge blocks of gray stone.  Five pillars stand in a line on both the east and west sides of the room, holding up a giant flat ceiling that lofts high overhead.  In each of the four corners of the room sits an enormous stone sconce, casting light and shadows throughout the room.  The feeling of age and serenity that radiates from the vast chamber is only increased by the vacant simplicity, making this large room feel more like a place of respect than one of fear or foreboding.  The stillness is disturbed occasionally by a gentle current of air, dancing off the distant sea. There are exits in each direction.

North.description: A mysteriously dark archway grants access into the cliffs.  It seems as though this room was created for the sole purpose or providing protection for this entrance.

East.description: Five pillars line the wall to the east, standing exactly opposite the five pillars on the west wall.  The pillars are arranged so that they are about six feet away from the wall itself, allowing passage between the pillars and the wall.  A perfectly squared off doorframe permits entrance into the Library.

South.description: A huge open entryway allows one to pass from this room back to the cove that leads to the Blue Fog Sea.

West.description: Five pillars line the wall to the west, standing exactly opposite the five pillars on the east wall.  The pillars are arranged so that they are about six feet away from the wall itself, allowing passage between the pillars and the wall.  A perfectly squared off doorframe permits entrance into the meeting room.

Up.description: The ceiling of the entrance hall is smooth much like the floor and walls, but some imperfections in the stone add texture to the room.  A hole in the in the middle of the ceiling allows natural light to fill the room.

Down.description: Plain and smooth, the floor is decorated with an endless story told in runes and symbols which have been drawn over many years.

extras.text: Gray/stone-Each cut block has been ground to a smooth finish, but remains unpolished and unadorned and generally unmarred by the forces of time and weather.  Creating these blocks must ahve required lots of willpower, and hours upon hours of hard dedicated labor.
Each of these enormous stone pillars is made of numerous round blocks of solid stone, keeping the weight of the ceiling from crashing down into the hall.

Dark obsidian that has been crafted into an ancient gothic archway, leading into a pitch-black room beyond.  Numerous religious symbols and icons are carved into the archway, indicating that this is not a safe place for the unknowing.  Seven tiny purple candles have been ensconed in the archway, three along each side and one at the top.  They burn very dimly, more to create shadows from object, the light by which to see.

The ceiling of the entrance hall is smooth much like the floor and walls, but some imperfections in the stone add texture to the room.  A hole in the in the middle of the ceiling allows natural light to fill the room.
These ancient runes seem to be moving slowly across the floor in a seemingly random pattern.  They don't seem to make any sense to you, but you can tell that they have a definite purpose.
The floor is smooth bare rock cut directly from the stone of the island itself, uniting the artificial and the natural.

rooms.name: A Shrine to the Shadows
rooms.description: Utter silence is one thing immediately noticed upon entering this dark shrine carved into the solid rock of the cliffs surrounding the island. Lacking the well-lit ambience of the rest of the guildhall, the shrine is lit dimly with purple candles placed at even intervals around the room that illuminate the vaulted ceiling irregularly, making shadows dance and play at the bare edges of perception, forming figures almost solid before dissipating into nothingness once again.  Against the far wall is an altar stone of black marble with a single blue taper burning steadily, always keeping the room between the realms of light and darkness.  Glinting against the walls of the shrine are marvelous mosaics set with lapis, amethyst, dark sapphire, and rare purple corundum.  The only exit is south through a short hallway back to the stone fountain.

South.description: A short, dark hall leads back to the stone fountain.

extras.text: The candles lighting the outer perimeter of the shrine are a deep purple in color and burn with a flickering light that does not drive back the shadows so much as invite them to dance.  Made of soft beeswax, they must be replenished often from a stack that sits behind the altar.  The lone candle on the altar itself is made of a much harder, dark blue wax and burns slowly yet steadily against the dark.

A moderately sized altar of rare black marble, it is inset with many runes to spread its protection over the entire guildhall.  On the front is a large symbol: an inverted triangle surrounded with a sphere on each side.

Barely visible in the dim lightning is a single mosaic running clockwise through the entire room that shows many different scenes from the mythology of the Goddess Kourrya.  Looks like mosaic1 would be a good place to start.

Here is the fabled story of Kourrya's ascension, with a humanoid figure dressed in purple and blue dying in the service of a blond-haired prince, her soul rising like a phoenix and joining with the shadow forces of the great cavern of her sacrifice and becoming something much greater.  The story continues on mosaic2.

Here is a mosaic of the young goddess making a deal with a massive dragon while strange creatures indiscriminately destroy cities and feast upon others in the background.  This marks the beginning of her fame as the Devourer of Souls.  The story continues on mosaic3.

This mosaic shows the goddess Kourrya in her own realm, watching over the worlds while being attended upon by her servant souls, some looking like ghostly humans and others looking like only indefinite blobs, or like nothing that was ever human.  The story continues on mosaic4.
The final mosaic shows Kourrya engaged in discussion with the founding Weavers of Fate, smiling in delight at the chance to have mortal agents in the world once again.

rooms.name: The Library of the Tapestry
rooms.description: The sheer height of this room is astonishing, easily over fifty feet high! Hundreds of thousands of books, covering every subject imaginable fill the bookshelves that reach from the floor to the ceiling.  The shelves on the north, south and west walls each have a single gap in the middle of the wall. Spread around the giant room are sturdy oak tables and large leather chairs, perfect for quiet reading and reflection.  A large loom lies at the foot of an enormous tapestry which hangs on the south wall between the gap in the bookshelves.  A tiny wind chime hangs in the east window, dwarfed even further by the massive size of the window, sounding out in response to the wind.

North.description: The shelves here cover subjects that begin with the letters "A" through "F". A great oak table fills the gap between the bookshelves here, providing a secluded study from the rest of the library.

East.description: The shelves here cover the subjects that begin with the letters "G" through "P".  A large open window is cut into the break on the east wall, allowing a cool fresh breeze to replace the stuffy air inherent to all library's.  A small wind chime sits in the window, occasionally ringing when the breeze picks up.

South.description: The shelves here cover subjects that begin with the letters "Q" through "V". In the break in the southern bookshelves hangs a giant tapestry, painstakingly embroidered over many years.  It is hung with great care, suspended from the ceiling by giant lengths of rope attached to a golden cord.  The bottom of the tapestry is also wrapped around a large golden rod, keeping the tapestry flat. On the ground before the tapestry is a giant loom, threaded with every color yarn imaginable.

West.description: The shelves here cover the subjects that begin with the letters "W" through "Z".  Through the opening in the wall, you can make out the stone fountain.

extras.text: A tiny trinket of a thing, each of the metal chimes is engraved with symbols for wind and air, elements commonly associated with the mind and the intellect. Truely, it must have another purpose other than to create pretty sounds.
A brief history of the major powers in the realms, identifying common enemies and allies makes up the fourth part of the tapestry.
A record of all the names of the clan members is embroidered in this section.
The gathering of the five founders of the Weavers, their names and titles recorded in simple symbols creates the original section of the tapestry.
Though not the original section of the great tapestry, the creation myths of the realms are woven together, creating an ideal about the foundation of life and being: balance.
There are many sections on the great tapestry, and studying the entire thing could take hours.  Looking at section1 would be a good place to start.

This giant tapestry is dozens of years old and has been worked on numerous times.  Every kind of material has been used to create the most perfect color and texture for every single minute detail-leaves of tree are actually dyed with colors derived from tree leaves.  Apparently, it's a visual record of the entire history of the Weavers and their interactions with the world, told in symbols and pictures.  There are several distinct sections that have been added to what was probably the original tapestry.

What could easily be considered an industrial loom rests here.  It is a machine that can take years to learn to use at all, let alone with any degree of proficiency, and only those spinners with a supernatural hand can hope to ever master it.  The loom is also a symbol of the work that the weavers do, the tapestry is truly just a metaphor for the results of the work.  Threads made of a multitude of colors and materials are organized in a huge cabinet near the loom, ready to be used at any time.

These sturdy wooden ladders are mounted on tracks which allow a person to roll from one side of a wall to another.  The ladders reach floor to ceiling. When rolling on the tracks, they make very little noise.

Hese enormous bookshelves are each about twenty feet wide and fifty feet tall, fitting tightly together from floor to ceiling, and wall to wall.  Each unit is made of highly finished oak, very plain but attractive.  Attached to the bookcases is an intricate system of rolling ladders which allow access to the various scrolls, books, and tomes of knowledge.

Each oil lamp here has a unique cut crystal hood.  Some are stained in many colors, others are either stained or perhaps burned completely black, and some have no staining or coloring at all.  However, regardless of the style or design, each lamp is a small work of art.

Each oak table is finished in the same varnish as the bookshelves, bringing the room together.  Fine crystal hooded oil lamps adorn several of the tables, providing reading light for those who wish to study.  Random stacks of books remain unshelved on several of the tables, breaking the orderly fashion of the rest of the room.
The large chairs are very comfortable and make excellent places to sit and read for hours on end.  Each leather armchair looks like it is fairly old.

rooms.name: The Council Room
rooms.description: A giant semi-circular table is placed against the far west wall, around which are five large chairs.  Facing the table are three sections of pews for members to sit in.  The walls, ceiling, and floor of this room appear to be covered in glowing runes.  The runes crawl from the floor to the ceiling, visiting each wall in turn before reaching their destination.  If you stare at one point long enough, you begin to see outlines of familiar figures on the peripheries of your vision, only to lose them when you try to get a closer look.  Exit is possible to the east, through a small hallway which leads into the room of the stone fountain.

East.description: The stone fountain lies to the east.

extras.text: This large table has a hole cut into the exact middle, allowing somebody, if they wished, to stand in the middle of it and give a presentation to the rest of the table.  The runes seem to leave this object alone, as it is not a natural part of the room.

A small tree springs up from the floor, forming a rather comfortable seat in the fork of its limbs.  Several of the branches form a crude triangle.  A snake has wrapped itself around the triangle, and will allow none to sit in the chair except for Janara.  Oddly, the triangle with the snake appears to be a symbol, as well as a means of protection.

Constructed from crystal clear ice, this throne is as hard to sit upon as it looks.  Mist rolls off of it as water in the air condenses due to the extreme cold of this chair.  Krytonius is the only person who can sit in this chair, because everybody else would just freeze to death.  A larger-than-life snowflake sits atop the throne, mounted on crystal pole which protrudes from the throne itself.

A rocking chair constructed of the finest wood belongs to the wisest and oldest weaver.  A soft pillow on the seat provides the old man with much needed cushioning for his increasingly boney posterior.  A small bedpan lays beside the chair, just in case the urge arises, and there isn't enough time to get back to town.  A strange symbol of a wolf holding a crystal ball in its jaws is painted onto the back of the rocking chair.

A large twisted onyx rock forms crude seat.  There appears to be no comfortable way to sit in this chair, and you begin to question the sanity of the one who sits here.  A crest, consisting of two swords crisscrossed over a shield suggests to you that this chair belongs to Nuggz.

The symbol of a pentagram with a slim crescent moon on either side is set in silver on this chair.  Clearly, this is Cerworn's seat.  An extremely decorative piece of furniture, the designs on it are intricate and complex, with one image flowing into the next like a giant web.  The chair is made of black-veined white marble and has white velvet padded cushions on the seat and the back.
Try starting with throne1, through throne5.
Etched into the walls are dark purple runes that contain no meaning for you. They glisten in the light cast by the flambeux placed in the corners of the room.
Each flambeau is made out of wrought iron, blacked from constant flames being burned in them.  There are four in all, one in each corner of the room.
Each section is marked with a different symbol, dividing the sections in good, neutral and evil, indicating where one is to sit during meeting.
